p: Dengue is an acute febrile illness caused by the Aedes aegypti mosquito-borne dengue viruses involving antigenically related flaviviruses of four serotypes [ 1]. The World Health Organization (WHO) recognizes the dengue virus as a major and emergent concern because of its expanding distribution and the increased frequency of epidemics [ 2, 3]. This disease is now predominant in America, Africa, the eastern Mediterranean, South East Asia, and the western Pacific [ 4]. Dengue hemorrhagic fever (DHF) is a prominent reason for death and serious illness in children in some Asian countries [ 1]. 90% of DHF victims are children under the age of 15 years [ 5].
